intro: Psychotria moyobambana, commonly known as the "Baptism of the Sun," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the rainforests of Central and South America, particularly in regions of Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
